revised_title: Harmonic Analysis of Tidal Observations at Dover and Ostend
tldr: This article presents the results of the harmonic analysis of tidal observations at Dover and Ostend, conducted by G. H. Darwin. The study examines the accuracy and irregularities of the tidal data collected from 1883 to 1885, comparing the two locations and discussing the implications of their findings. The authors conclude that the observations at Dover were made poorly, rendering many of the results unreliable, while the Ostend observations were of better quality.
